name: Dr. Matthew Cunningham
notes: First mayor of the Town of Little Rock

name: James Pitcher
notes: First mayor of the City of Little Rock

name: Jesse Brown
notes: From April 1839 through November 1839, Alderman Nicholas Peay acted as mayor due to prolonged absence of Mayor Brown.

name: Samuel G. Trowbridge
notes:
Elevated to mayor from mayor pro-tempore upon resignation of previous mayor.
Resigned upon arrest for running a counterfeit ring.

name: Thomas S. Reynolds
notes: Elevated to mayor from mayor pro-tempore upon resignation of previous mayor.

name: Eli Colby
notes: Elevated to mayor from mayor pro-tempore upon resignation of previous mayor.

name: Roswell Beebe
notes: Elevated to mayor from mayor pro-tempore upon resignation of previous mayor.

name: D. J. Baldwin
notes: Elevated to mayor from mayor pro-tempore upon resignation of previous mayor.

name: Charles (C.P.) Bertrand
notes: Stepson of first Little Rock Mayor, Dr. Matthew Cunningham.

name: Gordon N. Peay
notes: Son of Alderman Nicholas Peay who served as Mayor Pro-Tem during absence of Mayor Brown.

name: Upon occupation of Little Rock during the Civil War, city government ceased operations from September 21, 1863 through December 1865.
John Wassell
notes: Appointed by military to replace elected mayor.

name: A. K. Hartman
notes: The City Council suspended Hartman in February 1870; a court order overturned that in June 1870. In January 1871, he was again suspended by the Council and J. G. Botsford was declared Acting Mayor, though Hartman still claimed the title of Mayor through the remainder of his term in November 1871.

name: Jefferson George Botsford
notes: Appointed Acting Mayor in January 1871 and served through November 1871. Mayor Hartman was never officially removed from office, so Botsford was never technically Mayor. He has been historically listed as a Mayor of Little Rock, however.

name: John Gould Fletcher
notes: First mayor under new city charter. Father of John Gould Fletcher (Jr.)

name: William G. Whipple
notes: Son-in-law of Mayor R. L. Dodge.

name: Henry Lewis (H.L.) Fletcher
notes: Brother of Mayor John Gould Fletcher.

name: James A. Woodson
notes: Due to obligations with his business affairs, resigned in April 1900 to be effective upon election of his successor.

name: W. R. Duley
notes: Elected in a special election in May 1900. First time a special election had been used to fill mayoral vacancy.

name: Warren E. Lenon
notes: Due to obligations with his business affairs, resigned at first meeting of City Council held in the new City Hall, which he had championed.

name: John Herndon Hollis
notes: Though technically only Mayor Pro-Tempore selected by City Council to serve until special election for next Mayor, he has traditionally been included in lists of Mayors of Little Rock. He never gave up his Alderman seat on City Council and remained on Council after special election.

name: W. R. Duley
notes:
Chosen in a special election to fill vacancy created by resignation of Mayor Lenon.
Due to illness, Mayor Duley took a leave of absence from February 20, 1911 through the remainder of his term. Alderman John S. Odom was selected by the Council as Acting Mayor.

name: John Vines (J.V.) Satterfield, Jr.
notes: Due to illness, Mayor Satterfield took a leave of absence from January 1 through March 31, 1941. Alderman E. W. Gibb was selected by Council as Acting Mayor.

name: Sam M. Wassell
notes:
Starting date for mayoral terms moved from April to January.
Grandson of Little Rock Mayor John Wassell.

name: Pratt C. Remmel
notes: Mayor Remmel took a leave of absence to run for Governor from August 31 through December 13, 1954. Alderman Fred W. Parris was chosen by City Council to serve as Acting Mayor.

name: A. M. Sandy Keith
notes: Resigned as mayor but remained on the City Board of Directors.

name: Webster Hubbell
notes: Resigned as mayor but remained on the City Board of Directors.

name: Charles E. Bussey
notes:
From July – November 1981, served as Acting Mayor.
First African American mayor of Little Rock.

name: Lottie Shackelford
notes: First female mayor of Little Rock.

name: Dalton J. Jim Dailey, Jr.
notes: First served as mayor for two years under original City Manager structure, the elected to four-year terms by a citywide election in 1994, 1998, and 2002. Longest serving mayor of Little Rock (14 years).

name: Mark Stodola
notes: Incumbent mayor.
